rules.1: All Vasp flights are carried out ONLINE on the VATSIM or IVAO Networks;
rules.2: After the VA, the crew member must perform his first flight within a maximum period of 15 (fifteen) calendar days. Failure to comply with this rule will result in exclusion, enrollment;
rules.3: The pilot must respect his Rating, flying with the aircraft consistent with his license;
rules.4: We used FS2004, FSX, Prepar3d, Xplane 11 and FS2020 Simulators
rules.5: Pilots must use the 'UESVA' Application to report flights. The Vasp Virtual pilot must register on the 'UESVA' website, as well as download the 'Acars CLient' from the website
rules.6: All components of Vasp Virtual must follow the rules of the Networks that are flying. Any problem within the scope of the Simulation Networks must first be brought to the attention of the respective managers of each Network;
rules.7: Access to Virtual Vasp is carried out through a test with 10 multiple choice questions where we will assess basic knowledge about simulation and navigation;
rules.8: Our Career Plan consists of 3 Ratings that will be obtained according to the pilot's flight hours within the VA.
